title: A Lightweight Timestamp-Based MAC Detection Scheme for XOR Network Coding in Wireless Sensor Networks
abstract: Network coding has become a promising approach to improve the communication capability for WSN, which is vulnerable to malicious attacks. There are some solutions, including cryptographic and information-theory schemes, just can thwart data pollution attacks but are not able to detect replay attacks. In the paper, we present a lightweight timestamp-based message authentication code method, called as TMAC. Based on TMAC and the time synchronization technique, the proposed detection scheme can not only resist pollution attacks but also defend replay attacks simultaneously. Finally
